name: disinflation
content:

a reduction in the rate of inflation (= general increase in prices): Normally, a financial crisis leads to disinflation as the economy slows down. Disinflation is a decrease in the rate of inflation rather than a fall in prices.
More examplesFewer examplesFurther disinflation with outright deflation in some areas is likely to continue. Disinflation in these categories mainly reflects very low demand for these goods and services. At some point, this disinflation will cease and the inflationary force will kick in.
